intro: Clutia vaccinioides, commonly known as the dwarf clutia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It produces small, round berries that contain several seeds. Clutia vaccinioides is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive foliage.
